description: To stimulate sustainable private sector led growth that benefits the poor in Nigeria

subproject.corporate outcome: Policies, strategies and partnerships established to enhance public-private sector collaboration and private sector and market development that benefit the poor and ensure that low-income households and small enterprises have access to a broad range of financial and legal services
subproject.description: The Access to Renewable Energy Project aims to expand access to renewable energy services accessible to Small and Medium Scale Enterprises byfacilitating renewable energy investments and increase finance options for renewable energy uptake. Under the project, UNDP supports in developing the capacity and knowledge of financial institutions, and energy service providers, government, MSMEs and other relevant stakeholders to invest in and improved access to reliable and renewable energy service options available for MSMEs and rural use. This support also includes promotion of policies and institutional frameworks that will encourage inclusive renewable energy market development.
subproject.gender code: Gender equality as a significant objective
subproject.title: Access to Renewable Energy

subproject.corporate outcome: Policies, strategies and partnerships established to enhance public-private sector collaboration and private sector and market development that benefit the poor and ensure that low-income households and small enterprises have access to a broad range of financial and legal services
subproject.description: The Access to Renewable Energy Project aims to expand access to renewable energy services accessible to Small and Medium Scale Enterprises byfacilitating renewable energy investments and increase finance options for renewable energy uptake. Under the project, UNDP supports in developing the capacity and knowledge of financial institutions, and energy service providers, government, MSMEs and other relevant stakeholders to invest in and improved access to reliable and renewable energy service options available for MSMEs and rural use. This support also includes promotion of policies and institutional frameworks that will encourage inclusive renewable energy market development.

subproject.title: Access to Renewable Energy

subproject.corporate outcome: Policies, strategies and partnerships established to enhance public-private sector collaboration and private sector and market development that benefit the poor and ensure that low-income households and small enterprises have access to a broad range of financial and legal services
subproject.description: The Access to Renewable Energy Project aims to expand access to renewable energy services accessible to MSMEs by facilitating renewable energy investments and increase finance options for renewable energy uptake. Under the project, UNDP supports in developing the capacity and knowledge of financial institutions, and energy service providers,  MSMEs and other relevant stakeholders  at the State Governments level to invest in and improved access to reliable and renewable energy service options available for Small and Medium scale enterprises an rural use. This support also includes promotion of policies and institutional frameworks that will encourage inclusive renewable energy market development.
subproject.title: Access to Renewable Energy

subproject.corporate outcome: Policies, strategies and partnerships established to enhance public-private sector collaboration and private sector and market development that benefit the poor and ensure that low-income households and small enterprises have access to a broad range of financial and legal services
subproject.description: Facility for Inclusive Markets seeks to catalyse the rapid scalling up of positive experiences of inclusive market approaches exercised by private and public players through advocacy alliances, knowledge management, capacity building and research.Facility for Inclusive Markets will provide knowledge and analysis on the engagement of poor and vulnerable groups in the economic process. Key outputs include: Developed and/or expanded value chains in agriculture and agro-industry, including through innovative corporate social responsibility to meet demand in domestic, regional or international markets whilst boosting productivity, value addition, employment and incomes especially in rural and peri-urban areas.
subproject.title: Expand Value Chains in Agric

subproject.corporate outcome: Policies, strategies and partnerships established to enhance public-private sector collaboration and private sector and market development that benefit the poor and ensure that low-income households and small enterprises have access to a broad range of financial and legal services
subproject.description: Facility for Inclusive Markets seeks to catalyse the rapid scalling up of positive experiences of inclusive market approaches exercised by private and public players through advocacy alliances, knowledge management, capacity building and research.Facility for Inclusive Markets will provide knowledge and analysis on the engagement of poor and vulnerable groups in the economic process. Key outputs include: Developed and/or expanded value chains in agriculture and agro-industry, including through innovative corporate social responsibility to meet demand in domestic, regional or international markets whilst boosting productivity, value addition, employment and incomes especially in rural and peri-urban areas.

subproject.corporate outcome: Policies, strategies and partnerships established to enhance public-private sector collaboration and private sector and market development that benefit the poor and ensure that low-income households and small enterprises have access to a broad range of financial and legal services
subproject.description:
Facility for Inclusive Markets will provide knowledge and analysis on the engagement of poor and vulnerable groups in the economic process, focussing at states level.
Key strategies include: 
-Assessment and planning for the development of value chains for one or two products 
-Capacity Development Programme to enhance entrepreneurship skills initiated and first set of partnerships agreed and completed
subproject.gender code: Gender equality as a significant objective
subproject.title: Expand value chain in agric.

subproject.corporate outcome: Capacities of national and local institutions enhanced to scale up proven MDG acceleration interventions and to plan, monitor, report and evaluate the MDG progress in the context of related national development priorities
subproject.description: An expanded base of private sector-based service providers targeting business and market development for Medium, Small and Micro Enterprises, particularly through inclusive finance and entrepreneurship training at the federal level. Project aims at increasing the number of SME operators able to use expanded access to finance to build knowledge, skills and systems, increase productivity and generate higher returns on investment.
subproject.gender code: Gender equality as a significant objective
subproject.title: Expand services of MSMEs.
